article.description: Lodrick Stewart came off the bench to score a career-high 22 points in USC's 87-82 win over BYU, but what he wanted to talk about most Saturday night was defense.
article.headline: Stewart scores career-best 22
article.linkText: USC defense comes through for vs. BYU
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Lodrick Stewart came off the bench to score a career-high 22 points in USC's 87-82 win over BYU, but what he wanted to talk about most Saturday night was defense. "Yeah, people were making shots," the sophomore guard said, "but it was more defense than offense. (The win) came on our defensive end." Case in point: immediately after Stewart scored his final two points on a pair of free throws that stretched USC's lead to 83-79 with just 18 seconds left, BYU botched an inbounds pass that USC's Gregg Guenther gathered in and turned into a lay-up to make it a six-point game. USC's Gabriel Pruitt then stole the ball from Keena Young and dunked it with eight seconds left to put the game on ice. When the night was finally over, the Trojans (2-2), who'd given BYU (1-5) fits with various presses throughout the game, had 10 steals and had forced the Cougars into 21 turnovers. "The difference today was the press," Stewart said. "We did a lot of different presses, and it confused them. They've got some of the quickest guards in the nation, but we really confused them." Offensively, the Trojans spread the ball around well as five players finished in double figures. Rory O'Neil had 20, Pruitt 16 and Nick Young and Nick Curtis each had 10. USC led at halftime, 44-30, for the first time this season, and the Trojans stretched their advantage to 17 early in the second half before BYU rebounded to make it tense. The Cougars went on a 20-3 run, tying the game at 56 on a Mike Rose 3-pointer with 10:50 remaining. Less than a minute later, Jimmy Balderson's two free throws gave BYU a 60-58 lead, but the Trojans eventually took control again, going on a 12-0 run to take a 76-64 lead with 6:09 left. But BYU wasn't done. The Cougars went on a 15-5 spurt--capped by another Rose three--to close within two, 81-79, with 1:50 remaining. That's when USC's defense closed it out. "For us to lose a 17-point lead and hang on says a lot about the character of this team," USC coach Henry Bibby said. "We kept fighting and working."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
